>
> Port already in use: 8849




This indicates there is another piece of =
software on your system that is
currently accepting connections on TCP/IP p=
ort 8849, which according to the
wiki
<https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/dis=
play/Heritrix/HOWTO+Launch+Heritrix#HOWTOLaunchHeritrix-RemoteJMXConfigurat=
ion>
is
the default JMX port. That wiki page says that one can change the d=
efault
JMX port through an environment variable named JMX_PORT, which you c=
an set
in the terminal window which launches heritrix via export JMX_PORT=
=3D8850 (or
8848, just as long as it's not 8849).


Without knowing more of=
 your environment, it's hard to help further, but
hopefully that will get y=
ou pointed in the right direction.


  -- /v\atthew




On Tue, Sep 6, 2016=
 at 8:58 PM, Ng Pui San ngps@... [archive-crawler]
<archive-crawler@y=
ahoogroups.com> wrote:


>
>
> Hi,
>
>
>
> We are trying to install and run=
 Heritrix in Linux environment. Have
> installed but there is issue running=
 Heritrix. Looking at the log file, we
> are seeing these errors.
>
>
>
> E=
rror: Exception thrown by the agent : java.rmi.server.ExportException:
> Po=
rt already in use: 8849; nested exception is:
>
>         java.net.BindExce=
ption: Address already in use
>
>
>
> Any advice?
>
>
>
> Thanks.
>
>
>
> R=
egards,
